review:
Bomberman-like game that takes place in the wild west. I was surprised how deep this game can go with all the features it has. 

On the other hand, no matter how fun the game is at first, it gets really repetitive after a while and unless you're that type of person who likes to torture him/herself by getting 100% completion, there isn't much of anything else in store for you once you defeat all the bosses. 

It's also good each time the maps are procedurally generated thus making the game a little less repetitive so you got at least something to look forward to while you're trying to grind digital numbers.

Honestly, even the original Bomberman wasn't that great, imo. However, this game does a decent job at bringing something new to the table.

author: {'steamid': '76561199101512747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2726, 'last_played': 1691734141}
review:
At its heart, this is a Bomberman-style game combining gritty Western storytelling and modern roguelike gameplay. Our protagonist Bombslinger is an ex-bandit who left his evil gang to get married. The problem is he took a lot of the gang's cash when he split and presumably used that to build the house that gets burned at the start. With nothing left, he sets out for revenge on all his old pals and meets a few oddities along the way.

Having long ago played Gameboy Bomberman quite a lot, the controls felt comfortable. Classic powersups like obstacle jumping and bomb kicking work as they always did (if you can find them) while getting more Bombs and Firepower comes from a new levelup system that has you choosing a stat to increase from three random options. Defeating enemies grants XP to levelup, and there's a nice XP bonus when you defeat multiple enemies at once, which works on chickens too by the way.

Bombslinger gains stat increases when he levels, finds stuff in the field (and he finds more keys and better stuff with a high Luck stat) or purchases stuff at shops using gold – of course there's a Gold Finding stat which increases those pickups, and a powerup which lowers the cost at shops. The Health stat is probably the most important as you can easily win the game with only health boosts and full recoveries. The other stats are Speed (which I preferred at 2 of 5) along with stats to increase a spirit gauge or make spirit recharge faster.

You'll want plenty of spirit because there's a decent number of weapons and tools you can use in addition to your bombs, like the excellent bear trap or very large bombs, and even some high-skill abilities such as arc-thrown weapons or hiding as an object. Other powers are free to use, from sometimes avoiding certain damage types to an overpowered dodge roll, or changing the way regular bombs work. Neat one-time consumables include the highly random snake oil and health-for-spirit injectors.

As in many roguelike games, you'll start each run with some starting perks and unlock more through gameplay. Eventually you can start with builds that will help with gaining other achievement perks, so get what you can and remember to abuse the Restart option in the pause menu if a run isn't going well. For example, getting 5000 gold may seem impossible, but there's a way.

Beyond the Adventure mode in the front menu, there's also a Battle mode for Remote Play or when you have others over, though you'll want competitive gamers who really like Bomberman because the mode is less a party and more a desperate fight. Take care though if you play against the tough CPU opponents as there's no way to pause or quit a fight after you die and two evenly matched CPUs can take a long time to kill each other.

Overall, the core gameplay elements are solid and this mashup of ideas works. Almost every boss battle is great, with some patience for the annoying gold-stealing guy and how the final boss is a joke once you realize his weakness. There's an excellent batch of visually-distinct regular enemies to explode, each with different abilities and exploit methods to discover, like the wolves which have trouble at corners when trying to escape.

A small complaint would be not getting XP when enemies accidentally kill each other. What if I engineered that to happen or they did so outside my control? Would it really make the game any worse if I got that XP? Also, I wish utility powers didn't take the same equipment slot as useful weapons.

Mostly I wanted a bit more control over the random elements; the cost of re-rolling a shop's inventory is high, the chests which cost money to open are a gamble, and field drops can be rare. All of this makes achievements to collect specific things more about luck (and playing the game a lot) instead of skill. If I could sell unwanted keys and things, that might make everything flow better, as well as being able to swap starting perks between zones.

In the story, it's not great that a lady gets fridged to start off this quest for vengeance, plus the game reminds you of that each time you start. Burning down the house would have been enough. But when the whole gang is dead and you're choosing the ending, there is something fitting about mercy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043607469', 'num_games_owned': 3077, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1684876177}
review:
Video: https://youtu.be/211YcbkXRDk

Really fun idea, especially an interesting way to play Bomberman single-player. I was definitely able to find enjoyment, although I'm not sure how much it's one you'd replay after beating the boss since there's only so much variety in a build, and achievements seem more annoying/tedious than fun.

The start of every run, in the beginning, is more rough than fun, with your bomb explosion being 1x1. This works fine in Bomberman when it's blocks that drop upgrades, but in this game, it's walking enemies that drop the goods. So you place a bomb behind them, and they simply keep walking away and avoid the explosion. You can't get upgrades from the blocks, so you have to predict and manipulate the enemy AI in a frustrating way.

Thankfully, once you unlock some upgrades from the rogue-lite side of things, runs start way better and you can pick up speed quickly. Pretty good boss variety for what the game is, and there are a decent amount of creative items, it's just you won't see a lot of them in a run and there's not really a way to manipulate that. You want all three boot upgrades in one run? Too bad, you explored every room and got to the final boss without ever seeing them.

All in all: Cool idea, I'd love to see a sequel, fun to beat, but has it's limits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116551445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1684879412}
review:
It’s bomberman in a cowboy hat. If you were expecting anything different, I don’t know why.

There are a few variations from the traditional bomberman, like a level-up system that gives greater control of progression than traditional power-up and a rouge-lite system of perks to choose from before each run, but nothing that really changes this game from being bomberman in a cowboy hat, except that it's also just a little but worse. The controls are a bit sloppy, making it easy to get caught on corners or lay a bomb on a powerup instead of picking it up. It's a bit buggy, I had it crash a couple of times. My biggest complaint is that there is no save option for campaign mode, the player has to do the campaign in one sitting. It’s possible to do, the game’s only ~1hr long (assuming no deaths that cause you to start over), but it’s still frustrating in this age of tight schedules and cheap computer memory to see a game demand you schedule a minimum amount of time to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050705438', 'num_games_owned': 1769, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 88, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1711894775}
review:
I wish there were more games like Bombslinger because in my opinion the market for Bomberman-likes is still too small.
In Bombslinger you play as a former boss of an outlaw gang in the wild west. The titular Bombslinger decided to leave his gang to live with his wife on a small ranch but because he took the money from their biggest heist with him, they kill his wife and burn down the ranch.
Now hellbent on revenge you hunt them one by one down.

The gameplay mixes the typical Bomberman formular with rogue-like elements. Each run is randomized for more replayability. You have to travel through multiple stages, each one having their own boss, a member of your former gang. In typical Bomberman fashion you can lay down bombs to kill enemies. The key here is to corner them with your bombs so they cannot escape the blast. Bombs can be chained together and all explode at the same time if the fire touches each other. This can be used to set up combos. Killing enemies gives you XP and killing multiple at the same time through your combos gives you a bonus. Leveling up allows you to improve your stats, more firepower, more bombs can be placed down, more speed and so on. If you have lost HP you can also refill them through a level up.
Your bombs deal also damage to you, so you want to avoid that.

There are many different enemies that have different kind of behaviours. The first enemies will either wander around aimlessy or will follow you if they see you. Later you get outlaws with revovlers that shoot you if they see you, wolves that charge at, farmers with shotguns that sleep but wake up if they here noises and even shamans that can summon lightning at your position. 
Luckily you can also find all kind of useful tools. You can find alternate bombs that have different effects, like a seeker bomb that fires a long flame wall that searches for enemies to kill them or the nitro bomb that completely blasts through obstacles and enemies alike. You can also find guns to shoot at enemies. One thing that you will find are snake oil flasks. Those act as random potions. You don't know what it will do until you drink it and it can benefit you or hurt you. It's still usually wortht he risk because you can get stat upgrades with those.

There is also a shop in each level where you can buy items for gold that you get from crates and enemies. What I really like here is that when you enter the shop, you realize that you are actually playing a 3D game despite the look. Suddenly you are in first person inside the shop, looking directly at the wares on display. It's really cool and I wish more games would do something like that.
That being said, the game is still in 2D fashion for the rest of it, it's just that the game mixes 3D environment with 2D sprites which is the reason why you won't immediately notice that the world is 3D. T´Besides shops there is no gameplay element that makes use of the 3D graphics.

One thing I like about this game is that achievements have a real use here. By completing an achievement you will unlock an item for your loadout. Before each run you can take up to four different items with you which will give you passive benefits. It allows you to go for a specific strategy or simply give you a headstart. It's not overwhelming in terms of power but it makes reaching certain milestones more rewarding. Thre is no other metaprogression besides that however, so you won't get more powerful with each run until you beat the game by sheer dominance.
There aren't any super powerful builds either to be honest, the focus is more on skillfully playing Bomberman with added randomization and items. This is in my opinion completely fine, it's a good Bomberman game although I do wish there were more items. Variety in this game is pretty scarce and that would be my biggst complaint. You will often see simiiar items in your runs, the variation mostly comes from how the stages are built.

The game also has a multiplayer mode, a classic arena mode like you know it. Kill the other players with your bombs, don't die yourself. It's good but it's only local multiplayer, which kinda sucks if you don't have friends at your home to play with. You  can play with Remote Play together but that is often laggy. But if you have friends at home, than you can have some good old-fashioned Bomberman battles, which is always fun.

review:
¿Un Bomberman roguelike con historia ambientada en el oeste y con gráficos pixel art? ¿He muerto y estoy en el cielo? XD

¡Es una pasada! ¡De los mejores bomberman que he probado! ¡Y desde los tiempos de la SNES/Megadrive/PCEngine  me he pasado un puñado de ellos! 

Quizás deberían añadir un "modo fácil", o alguna opción para guardar partida (más que nada por si en mitad de una run hay que parar y no se quiere perder el avance), pero por ahora me parece divertidísimo, se ve que le han puesto mucho cariño. 

A cada run vas aprendiendo cosas o desbloqueando nuevos objetos, y se siente todo muy bien integrado. Los enemigos son muy diferentes, dan ganas de llegar cada vez más lejos para encontrar más y ver lo que hacen. Y cuando mueres se siente justo, has muerto porque no lo has hecho bien, no porque el juego haya querido, a la próxima ejecutarás tu venganza (o no). Muy muy divertido ^^

Si te gustan los Bomberman o los roguelikes, te lo recomiendo al 100% :D

review: Love the concept...it's Binding of Isaac meets Bomberman. But I really hate the execution. The pacing is so slow and boring because you spend so much time chewing your way through the terrain of every room bit by tedious bit with bombs. And changing directions is pure, absolute frustration. The controls are so awful and sluggish...your character constantly gets hung up on the indestructible parts of the terrain. I guarantee you will blow yourself up trying to get out of the way of your own bombs far more often than the slow, predictable enemies will kill you.

review:
Pros:
- overall the game is fun
- nice art style
- different builds are possible
- some degree of replayability(different bosses, unlockable starting items, levels layouts randomly generated each playthrough)
- not a lot of bomberman-like games out there

Cons:
- the game starts slow. Your avatar moves slow, has one bomb with one title blast radius. I almost dropped the game at first, but struggled through the first couple of runs and luckily unlocked a couple of items which made the game less tedious
- random is not fun here. Some starting items unlocks(and steam achievements) are heavily depends on random. For example you need to collect 3 certain items to unlock 1 starting item. And either the game will spawn them in a shop or in chests, or it won't and there is nothing a player could do about it. Sometimes a level is long(more enemies = more gold), sometimes it is short, so no shopping for you. Sometimes there are two shops on a level, sometimes - only one. Sometimes there are several key locked chests on a single level, sometimes - only one chest for a whole run. I hate random in this game.
- the final boss arguable is less challenging of all bosses, just stay at a top lane.

review:
It's basically Bomberman with roguelike elements. I'm a big fan of the roguelike genre and played the hell out of Bomberman in my childhood, so I should be liking this game. But I don't.

Goddamn is it SLOW. You begin with a bomb with an explosion radius of a single square and have to carefully place the bombs and pray for the enemy to not randomly move away from the bomb and  avoid dying out of sheer luck... which happens half the time. You also have to manually clear dozens of obstacles in your way by laying a bomb and waiting for it to blow up each time. Suuuper slow and boring game start.

Then I reached the boss and he moves around pretty fast around a gigantic arena, so again, you keep laying bombs and hope that EVENTUALLY the starts will align just right so that the boss will come in contact with your bomb. 
I tried again and it was a different first boss this time, but he used this same "mechanic" where you have to wait until HE decides to use the ONLY attack which leaves him vulnerable, which happened once right away but then didn't happen again after two minutes, and when he finally decided to expose himself again, I died.

Oh, and when you die, you have to start from scratch without keeping any of the gold and items found (permadeath).

I'm noping the fuck out of this. If the first level is any indication, this game is too slow, too luck based and too punishing. Refunded.

review:
Played first level twice, died from dumb mistake, then to boss. Too tedious. The slow movement speed and the requirement to kill all enemies are terrible for an adventure roguelike. The original bomberman had you competing against other players, racing for power-ups. This game gives you unlimited time to grind and look for power-ups, making it a chore. I'd love this game if there was a way to play where:
- The player is much faster.
- Defeating enemies is optional (paths are always open, or maybe require just 1 kill to open)
- There's some reason to go fast other than the achievement, e.g. the boss gets an extra heart for every 3 minutes it takes to reach them, or lots of fires randomly appear over time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060076508', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 2698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2610, 'last_played': 1708557929}
review:
Probably the closest to a legitimate Bomberman experience you'll get to on PC, not just Steam, outside of emulation, and far more party-ready. The multiplayer is solid, and you can play online via Parsec (which I recommend if you've got a good connection for just about any local-multiplayer game).

The single-player is fun and has all the highs and lows of any other rogue-like game. Other than a few very rare bugs that can occur (especially frustrating toward the end of a very powerful run), the game runs very smoothly and without issues on a large variety of hardware. The bosses are extremely tough when starting, but are fairly predictable, and as a result this particular game is more consistent than most rogue-likes. The item variety adds a fair bit of strategy to the game, and it's fun messing with different builds to find either incredibly powerful builds that will allow for an easy run or succeed-or-suck builds that are a huge gamble with the possibility of quick death or deft victories. I've put in a lot of runs on this game and it's an excellent time killer with endless opportunities for fun during multiplayer. My only wish is that multiplayer would get more options for customization going forward. Other than that, the game is fairly flawless, and delivers on its promises excellently for both the experienced rogue-player and newcomers alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023092458', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1539349118}
review:
Alors attention, je mets un pouce rouge uniquement en guise d'avertissement pour ceux qui s'attendraient à ce que, s'inspirant ouvertement de Bomberman, ce jeu fasse un sympathique jeu canap' pour jouer avec des amis. Il n'en est rien, le jeu est entièrement tourné vers le solo et le mode multijoueur ne relève que de l'ajout marginal sans intérêt.

POUR LE SOLO : on a droit à un "rogue-like", ou plutôt un Isaac-like pour être précis : on enchaine les arènes reliées entre elles par des passages selon un agencement labyrinthique, le but étant de trouver le boss pour clore chaque niveau tout en boostant son perso au passage par le biais d'équipements divers et variés, qui apportent des variations sympa autour du principe de départ de Bomberman, avec de même des ennemis variés offrant des comportements intéressants pour exploiter le gampelay de façon assez riche. Sur cette partie solo, le jeu est donc très engageant, même si reste contraint par les limites du genre et apporte un contenu loin des ténors du genre.

POUR LE MUTLI : on a malheureusement droit à un bomberman-like se contentant du minimum syndical sur ce point : les parties sont peu paramétrables (rien notamment sur les conditions de départ autre que les points de vie, et aucun mode de jeu particulier), les arènes assez nombreuses en nombre s'avèrent n'apporter que très peu de variété réelles en jeu, et la majorité des idées qu'apporte le solo à la formule originelle ne sont pas présentent en multi .... donc au final multijoueur vraiment anecdotique, alors que c'était ce qui faisait la force de Bomberman, donc attention de ne pas se méprendre sur ce point !

review:
This game isnt really bad. If you want a cheap version of bomberman then this game could be okay for you. 
Just everything feels kinda simple and not smooth enough in controls. 

First Multiplayer: Simple Bomberman-version on a few too simple maps. Nothing that special here to mention. Nice that you can play with bots if you want.

Adventure-mode: Was hoping this would be cooler. Its some kind of rogue-like-dungeon. You try to find the end boss in an area so you level lil bit up, get some money, get one,two items and then fight a boss. To get there you have to bomb enemies with different attacks in every field. where you first have to bomb your way through them. I didnt have fun with that. The enemies attacks and moving doesnt feel good and its more annoying to fight your way through to them than it feels challenging. If you die you start level again from the beginning in a new maze.

My problem is that it just felt more like working than having fun get to the enemies. You just bomb the same plants or fireplaces over and over again. I think it was a nice idea but maybe better buy on sale.
I had much more fun with the Bomberman Jump and Run on N64 than I had here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054449486', 'num_games_owned': 944, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1529990912}
review:
[h1]Por un puñado de bombas[/h1]

Para un forajido no es fácil dejar atrás una vida de crimen. Cuando nuestro protagonista decide abrirse de la banda para ir a vivir en paz con su familia, sus ex compañeros no se lo perdonan y prenden fuego su hogar, lo que provoca la muerte de su esposa. Desolado y con sed de venganza, este hombre no va a parar hasta asesinar a cada uno de ellos, haciendo lo que mejor sabe hacer... eh... poner bombas gigantes en el suelo y salir corriendo.

Si les decimos "una combinación de Bomberman con roguelite" ¿qué les viene a la mente? Sí, pensamos lo mismo: "¿Por qué no se nos ocurrió primero?". Mezclen eso con una temática western y gráficos retro, ¡y tenemos un ganador!

A simple vista, el fichin sigue las reglas del clásico Bomberman: en un escenario dividido en grilla, debemos colocar explosivos para destruir las paredes que nos impiden el paso, a su vez que eliminamos a los enemigos que quedan atrapados en su llamarada (que se extiende una casilla hacia los lados pero nunca en diagonal). Al igual que en el juego que lo inspira, debemos tener mucho cuidado de no ser alcanzados por esas llamas o también recibimos daño.

Pero a diferencia de lo que estamos acostumbrados, cada nivel está conformado por una serie de escenarios interconectados, a través de los cuales debemos navegar hasta encontrar la puerta al jefe final de esa sección. En varios de estos escenarios se cierran las puertas al momento de ingresar y sólo podremos salir cuando hayamos derrotado a todos los enemigos. ¡Exactamente! Se trata de un dungeon.

¡Eso no es nada! También podemos ir obteniendo puntos de experiencia a medida que hacemos volar tipos malos. Cuando alcancemos cierto puntaje podemos elegir una de tres posibles nuevas mejoras, como aumentar la velocidad, incrementar la onda expansiva de las bombas o recargarnos la salud, entre otros.

En el camino es posible encontrar llaves para abrir cofres que contienen armas e items, así como también reventar cajas que también los contienen. Algunos nos sirven para recargar nuestra salud, otros para aumentar nuestra esencia, y otros tienen efectos positivos a cambio de otros que pueden ser indeseados (como aumentarnos la velocidad pero quitarnos salud). Entre las armas extra que podemos encontrar, tenemos unas bombas especiales que lanzan llamaradas con una onda expansiva ridícula, otras que rastrean a los enemigos para destruirlos, e incluso una escopeta para dispararles a la vieja usanza. Las herramientas son muchas y probablemente nos encontremos un set distinto en cada partida. También es posible comprar algunas en las tiendas que nos cruzamos, aunque suelen tener precios muy caros.

Pueden leer el análisis completo acá: http://www.irrompibles.net/secciones/reviews/9216-bombslinger-review

review:
总的来说还可以，在炸弹人类中还算比较好玩的，可惜要素偏少，平衡性也比较差，不太耐玩，我玩了几个小时就完成速通通关，推荐打折可以入。
通关发现这游戏最重要属性的是跑步速度，速度够快（建议至少3以上）可以冲到敌人脸上丢完炸弹再潇洒的跑开，而且也能很容易躲过敌人攻击，像最终boss的攻击速度不够快是很难躲的，通关时间也短很多。其次是运气，运气高了会发现满地都是钥匙和道具还有+3hp的肉，什么商店价值750的硝基追踪炸弹，拿上一个就足够通关，反而钱根本没用，玩通关估计都凑不够750。第三是斗志回复速度，高级后道具无限用，斗志条上限有150都够了，一般每次消耗不会超过50。最后才是火力和炸弹数，有2-3级差不多了，太高反而容易误伤自己。

review:
Video Review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bC7Acnydi5c&t=67s

Bombslinger is a bomberman Esk Rogue-like single player action adventure game. Drop bombs to destroy terrain and enemies. Maps are randomly generated on each run through. Upgrades, level ups, items and more can all be found. Of course as well as Multiple enemies and bosses you must fight your way through. 

As I go through this review, keep in mind that I did receive this game free from the developer but I will do my best to write this from the perspective of someone who is looking to buy it. After all, I have received many free games but this is the first one I've actually done a review and talked about.

Before I get into more aspects of the game, let me waste no one's time. What everyone wants to know about, is this game even worth knowing about? In my opinion, yes. I would give this indie game a solid B and a C+ grade for asking price. While that may seem like low grades to you, it's high for me for an indie game and the C+ is simply because $12 seems slightly high, and I probably wouldn't have bought it unless it hit a sale. Of course if really enjoy these types of games or you love to support indie developers then I'd say it can be worth full price as it's the same price as a movie ticket and I've already played multiple hours of the game, with more runs to do before I can beat it for the first time.

So now that that's out of the way, what exactly are the details of the game, and why have I enjoyed it?

To start off, this game actually does kick your butt. From a first glance, it can seem pretty simple and more of a casual game. Place bombs down, run away, wait for enemies to be blown up. But as you progress, enemies get way tougher. You have to watch multiple enemies at one time, make sure you have a strategy for each type of enemy, and try not to make those silly little mistakes that make your face bruised and red because of all the face palming you'll do. Actually this game is so difficult, especially at first, that I almost gave up on the game as I couldn't even beat the first boss within almost an entire hour of gameplay.
On one of my last runs, I finally took down a boss before deciding to quit. Doing so unlocked more to the game. If you don't mind a little bit of a challenge, this game has a great feel of progression and accomplishment when you actually do end up getting further than before on a run. Each time you get further, it gives you more power to keep getting further and further.

Speaking of which, that is the second part of the game that I really enjoy, the unlocks and variety. While the concept of the game is simple, the strategies that you get to decide on between items, starting power ups, purchases and leveling upgrades, gives you multiple ways to try to play the game, each with their own advantage. For example, the further you get into the game, the more starting power ups you get, and you get to decide from. For example, you can pick extra bombs, health or fire power, or pick out an ability to kick bombs, or have bomb fuses longer so that you can string more explosions on top of one another. There is definitely a bit of RNG on each run so you can't use the same in game strategy every time as sometimes you'll get guns and other times different styles of bombs. 

That brings me to another point about this game. With any Rogue-like game that has perma death and randomly generated maps, a defining question becomes, how does the RNG feel? Well with any game that is influenced by RNG, it sometimes feels really bad like dying from drinking snake oil or not getting a health refill when you really need one. Sometimes it feels amazing when you open a chest and your favorite weapon pops out. Overall though the RNG doesn't feel too extreme and it only left me ragging on about 2 runs out of the 30 I did.

Other features of the game include full controller support that works well, local multiplayer that I can't try out because I have no friends and this isn't a game my wife would enjoy, and steam achievements. The downsides to the game that I have found is a limited soundtrack that gets a bit old after many runs, and that the starts to each run feel really slow until you unlock enough starting upgrades. Often in the first parts of the runs, you are simply waiting to blow up a lot of obstacles with the single bomb you have. The more you unlock, the less bad the start to the game feels, however it does take effort to get there.

Finally, who would I recommend this game to? While I don't think this game is for everyone, I think if you like a good challenging video game, love rogue-likes, especially the binding of Isaac, then this is a game you should really consider getting or at least putting onto your wishlist. Also those who grew up on 90's videos games like myself, will deinitely enjoy bombslinger as it brought me back to the good old days of sega and old nintendo systems. I would not recommend this game for those who don't like pixel graphics, singleplayer games, or a games that test your limits. Controllers beware of raging hormonal teens!

review:
Bombslinger is a roguelike in the vein of Binding of Isaac with Bomberman style combat and wild west stylings. At first, the Bomberman combat is a bit more plodding than BoI’s tear shooting, but the clever enemy design keeps you fully engaged. In the first level there are standard patrolling grunts, as well as rams that charge in a straight line and shotgun wielders that take cunning to kill. The level format stays true to the Zelda-inspired interconnected rooms of BoI – keeping you from moving forward until you clear all your foes.

You start with the ability to place one bomb at a time, with a one-tile range. Very quickly you get exposed to the vectors for increasing your arsenal: use coins from fallen foes in shops, level up by clearing rooms and unlock treasure chests. These things could increase your stats (which include your bomb capacity and range), grant you one time use items or give you new weapons that use your “spirit” meter (which acts like mana/magic does in most games).

This all combines for fun roguelike gameplay where you unearth new knowledge on every run. But what I came away most impressed by was the presentation of Bombslinger. The low-poly, low-res texture look is used to amazing effect here. There’s also good attention to detail with the visuals – for example, you can see the shadow of the clouds crossing the map above the camera’s field of view. And the soundtrack! The soundtrack has an incredibly slick rock & blues sound that’s generous with the electric guitar.

Não é apenas um clone de Bomberman!

É lógico que ao bater os olhos você pensa logo em um Bomberman no velho oeste, porém o jogo vai bem além. Ele usa a mecânica de bombas, mas também é um jogo que você vai passando por áreas, dando um clima de jornada, e é um roguelike, portanto se morrer volta pro começo, mas com todos os itens que coletou disponíveis para equipar. Ou seja, a cada partida você está mais poderoso. O visual é fenomenal, pelas imagens pode parecer 2D pelas texturas pixelizadas, mas é um jogo 3D com visão aérea que é lindo de se ver. author: {'steamid': '76561197993473791', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1523953588}
review:
XBOX Oneコントローラーを使用。

[u]西部のギャング団の一員である主人公「BombSlinger」だったが、結婚を機にギャング団を抜けることになる。だが、主人公を逆恨みしたギャング団によって妻が殺されてしまったことにより、「BombSlinger」の復讐の旅が始まるのだった。「ボンバーマン」にインスパイアされたローグライトなステージクリア型アクション。[/u]

ローグライクな要素として死んでしまうと最初のステージからレベルと所持品がリセットされた初期状態でプレイすることとなる。アンロックした装備品は引き継がれる。

[h1][b]【良い点】[/b][/h1]

◆ ゲーム性はシンプルでステージはいくつかのエリアに区切られており、エリア内の敵を全滅させると次のエリアへ進むことができる様になり、各ステージのラストにいるボスを倒すとステージクリア、次のステージへと進むことができる。各ステージのボスはある程度ランダムなので、プレイ毎に出現するボスが異なるので注意が必要だ。

◆ 主人公にはいくつかのステータスがあり、本家（？）「ボンバーマン」でお馴染みの「ボムの火力」や「同時におけるボム数」以外にも「移動速度」「運（アイテムとお金のドロップに影響）」等がある。最大の違いとしては「HP」と下記するサブウェポンを使用すると消費される「スピリット」が存在している。

◆ 今作ではボムで攻撃する以外にもサブウェポンを使用しての攻撃ができ、このシステムがなかなか良い味を出している。サブウェポンは敵がドロップしたり、ショップでの購入で入手が可能だ。サブウェポンには近距離攻撃用の「ショットガン」や弾丸が発射されて遠くを攻撃できる「ピストル」等があり、使用すると「スピリット」が消費される。個人的には遠くを攻撃できる「ピストル」の使い勝手が良く、使い方次第ではボス戦が大分楽になる。サブウェポン使用時に消費される「スピリット」は初期状態で最大値が「100」だが、レベルアップやショップでの強化で増加が可能だ。

◆ 各プレイ開始時に装備品を選択することができ、各装備品には「初期最大HP上昇」「初期ボムの火力上昇」等の効果がある。装備品はゲーム開始時点では一つしか装備できないものの、一定個数の装備品をアンロックすることで装備可能な数が上昇していく。装備品は一定の条件をクリアすることでアンロックされていく仕様になっており、上記した通り、一度アンロックしてしまえば死亡してしまっても引き継がれる。アンロック条件は「敵をトータルで250体撃破」や「特定のボス撃破」等がある。

◆ 「ボンバーマン」でお約束のブロック（障害物）を壊していき、パワーアップアイテムを入手する事が今作ではできず、主人公のレベルを上昇させることでパワーアップアイテムが入手できる様になっている。敵を撃破すると経験値がたまっていき、一定値になるとレベルが上昇する。敵を同時に複数撃破することにより、ボーナス経験値を取得することもできるので積極的に狙っていこう。レベルアップ時に三つのパワーアップから一つを選択して主人公を強化していく仕様になっている。パワーアップは「ボムの火力上昇」「同時に配置できるボムの最大値上昇」「最大HP上昇」ステータスをアップさせるもの以外にも「HPとスピリット回復」等がある。上昇した能力はステージ間で引き継がれる。

[h1][b]【悪い点】[/b][/h1]

◆ 稀に操作時（移動）にラグが発生するのか、主人公がボムを配置後に動くまでに時間がかかることがある。

[h1][b]【総評】[/b][/h1]

現時点でもできが良く、ボンバーマン好きであれば間違いなくオススメだし、レベルやサブウェポン等のオリジナルの要素も面白いものになっている。装備品をアンロックしていく事でプレイすればプレイするほどゲームを有利に進めることが可能になっているのも好感触だ。

プレイ動画をアップしているので、気になった方は[u][url=https://youtu.be/7Wnn1WvFZSU]こちら[/url][/u]を参考までにどうぞ。

review:
Quick video review here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0jY4ovwD3nU

My only complaint with this game is the movement. It feels like sometimes I move more or less than what I expected when I release the d-pad. Also, the game doesn't detect diagonal movements as any input and so if you don't realize you're pressing a on the diagonal, you won't move.

However, it's very easy to get over those annoyances to find a really fun game. Learning enemy patterns, reactions, and abilities feels a bit like playing Crypt of the Necrodancer except without the beat keeping you sufficiently stressed out. The levels are pretty chill, you can almost always play at your own pace. The boss battles however are hectic puzzles requiring you to dodge attacks while trying to figure out how to properly damage the boss.

Multiplayer is a plus, though I haven't played it much.

A great price for what you get.

[/quote]

《Bombslinger》是Mode4于2018年4月11日在STEAM的发售的新产品，游戏采用像素画风，背景设定为一位金盆洗手的农场主为了拯救自己的妻子走上了和暴徒对抗的道路。其核心玩法仍然是传统的炸弹人类型，玩家操纵游戏人物放置炸弹攻击敌人，↑↓←→控制人物移动，空格键放置炸弹。
游戏分为两种模式，其一为冒险模式，其二为对抗模式。

[u]冒险模式[/u]
玩家在随机生成的地图里，面对着随机生成的敌人，收集各种道具，一路过关斩将，获取经验进行升级并提高自己能力，击杀一个个BOSS直到最终取得游戏胜利。
玩家拥有五种属性，分别是[b]移动速度[/b]、[b]幸运值[/b]（影响玩家获得道具和金钱）、[b]斗志[/b]（玩家使用道具会消耗斗志）、[b]斗志回复速度[/b]（斗志会自动回复，大概是1点/s）、[b]金币获得量[/b]。
玩家通过击杀敌人，获得经验，升级之后可以从三种不同能力中选择自己偏好的能力，选择升级时会暂停当前游戏，玩家既可以根据长远的角度去选择[b]增加炸弹数量、提高炸弹威力[/b]，也可以当生命值较低时选择[b]回复全部生命[/b]。

除了属性选择，《Bombslinger》还给玩家提供了数十种道具可供选择，道具又分为[b]主动道具[/b]和[b]被动道具[/b]，在冒险模式中玩家在游戏开始前可以选择一种初始道具，游戏中拥有两个道具栏位，在左上角显示，玩家可以通过S和F使用它们。被动道具在屏幕下方的经验条上面显示。
道具的获取方式分为[b]宝箱掉落[/b]、[b]商店购买[/b]。
玩家在冒险的过程中会随机遇到宝箱，普通的木头箱子可以通过炸弹炸烂（会掉落斗志和金币），除此之外还有上锁的箱子（用钥匙开）和金币箱子（用一定的金币开），在某些房间还有遇到商店（提供三种道具）。
不同的道具给了玩家不同能力，让玩家的冒险旅途不只局限于简单放置炸弹。

游戏中的敌人也有很多种类，普通敌人移动缓慢，且AI较低，基本只会沿着固定的路来回巡逻；有的敌人会携带燃烧弹，当发现玩家时会向玩家方向投掷；有的敌人开始处在睡眠状态，玩家靠近之后会惊醒并进入狂暴状态；还有小山羊，接近时会使其进入警戒状态，一秒后向玩家方向直线冲锋，碰到炸弹或者障碍停下。大部分敌人被炸弹炸一下就会死亡，玩家如果和敌人接触会掉一滴血。玩家如果想快速升级，就尝试用一枚炸弹击杀尽可能的多的敌人，会有额外的经验加成。
除了敌人之外，地图上也有很多机制，比如炸药桶，引爆之后会以十字方式整条直线爆炸，玩家可以利用这些更方便的击杀敌人。
当你获得了足够的升级，拿到了道具，是不是想去找BOSS试一试手？BOSS房间在地图上以骷髅图标显示，当你清理完BOSS房间前的小怪房间，BOSS的门会自动打开，快做好准备去挑战BOSS吧！

清理完暴徒，愤怒的黑山羊在前面“羊视眈眈”的看着你。
作为游戏中的第一个BOSS，黑山羊有两种能力，第一种是召唤两只小山羊，第二种是可以将玩家放置的炸弹踢开，直到碰到障碍停下。
第二种能力让玩家无法通过炸弹封路的方法困住它，要打倒它，玩家必须要预判出山羊经过的路径并提前放下炸弹，大概三到四次之后，黑山羊颓然倒下，玩家解锁了一个新的道具（可以使你在游戏开始时炸弹数量加一），然后出现了一匹小马，快骑着它开始新的征程吧！


[u]对抗模式[/u]
作为《Bombslinger》的第二种模式，对抗模式目前一共提供了十二张不同风格的地图，供本地多人游戏和AI进行对抗，AI不是很蠢有一定挑战性。
对抗模式分为DeathMatch（以下简称DM）和LastManStanding（以下简称LMS）两种。
DM模式游戏规则是人物每击杀一人记一分，死亡后可以复活（复活有无敌时间，且不限复活次数），直到有一人达到规定的分数游戏结束。
LMS模式游戏规则是人物死亡后不能复活，直到最后剩下一个人时游戏结束。

在对抗模式中，玩家没有初始道具，游戏中炸掉方块会掉落道具，且游戏每隔一段时间都会暂停并下落新的方块和道具，被动道具比如提高炸弹能力、增加炸弹数量、可以踢开炸弹，还有风滚草、弹簧鞋（暂时不知道用处）等等，主动道具有霰弹枪步枪（远程攻击一条直线）、核弹（十字炸全图）、燃烧弹（可投掷，燃烧一片地面）等等。多种道具的加入又让对抗有了无穷的变化和乐趣，试想当你正躲在石头后面等着引爆炸弹，却被敌人在远处一枪爆头……快复活投入新的战斗吧。

《Bombslinger》创新之处，就在于它将时下流行roguelike因素巧妙的和炸弹人这一经典的游戏类型相结合，赋予了它新的生命力和游戏乐趣，玩家既可以从中寻找到当年在游戏机上玩炸弹人时的温暖回忆，又可以完完全全享受到roguelike带来的无穷魅力。
然而作为一款还在抢先体验版本的游戏，仍存在着很多的不足。
在刚进入游戏时，人物的操作手感并不尽如人意，按下移动键之后人物并不能及时作出反应，好像有几毫秒的延迟。
冒险模式中，在杀光每个房间的敌人之后，我还不得不炸掉一些方块从而清理出一条道路到达下一个房间，实在是很浪费时间影响游戏体验。
作为roguelike游戏，死亡之后重新开始之后应该是正常的游戏过程，但在该游戏中，由于BOSS的难度较大，我不得不浪费大量的时间一遍遍的从头开始，这使我解锁道具的过程变得无比漫长并且要经历不怎么有挑战性的普通房间。
游戏当前的敌人、道具、BOSS还比较少，而且每关关底的BOSS都是相同的，或许像以撒那样有很多BOSS轮换会是一个好的选择。
对抗模式并不能调整UI难度，玩家可能无法获得较强的对抗性。而且目前没有网络联机，无法和和网络上别的高手过招，也是一大遗憾。

我们目前可以预测到的是，游戏在未来会推出更多种类的敌人和道具，增加能力更多样的BOSS，其潜力仍然无比巨大。
如果你是一个roguelike游戏爱好者，玩以撒的高手，过去和你的朋友一起沉迷过炸弹人，不妨来试一试这款《Bombslinger》，来尝试下别样的炸弹人，重温当年那些美好的回忆。

author: {'steamid': '76561198020087176', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1523303151}
review:
**Tengo más horas debido al modo offline de Steam no se ven** 

Siempre han habido títulos inspirados en grandes IPs, y Bomberman es una de ellas, en este caso, nosotros hemos estado probando Bombslinger; un juego que toma la jugabilidad del exitoso juego de hacer volar en pedazos a los enemigos con bombas pero agregándole un toque especial con una ambientación al estilo el Viejo Oeste.

Como bien lo explicamos arriba, nuestro objetivo será acabar con los enemigos en pantalla, con la tradicional jugabilidad de movernos por entre distintos obstáculos, haciendo volar objetos (en  matas de maíz, césped, cajas con loot, etc.) para hacernos con mejoras en nuestro armamento, para lograr obtener ventaja sobre los contrincantes antes de intentar hacerles trizas con las hermosas bolitas explosivas. Esto, ya sea en el modo competitivo local contra otros jugadores amigos nuestros, o en su modalidad de campaña, donde nos veremos las caras ante diferentes jefes y muchos diferentes tipos enemigos en niveles generados proceduralmente, en nuestros intentos, topamos con cabras locas, granjeros con rastrillos, algunos vaqueros con armas -que pueden hacer volar nuestras bombas si sus disparos les alcanzan, coyotes con ganas de mordernos, y hasta un tipo en una trinchera con una mini-gun (tenganle miedo). Todo, dentro de un marco y niveles recreados en un hermoso arte de pixeles en un HUD bastante limpio y agradable a la vista del jugador.
 
La vertiente o modo para un solo jugador se presenta como un escenario rogue-like, donde vamos a ir intentando avanzar la mayor cantidad de pantallas posibles, hasta morir. En cada pantalla, toparemos con un jefe bien loco al final, todos sedientos de oro, y que nos harán la vida bastante difícil. Nosotros topamos con un calvo alcohólico-pirómano que daba vueltas lanzando fuego tras beber alguna sustancia inflamable, que en realidad no fue tan complicado, también vimos a un jefe coyote que hacía arremetidas contra nosotros al vernos, y que a su vez, tiene la capacidad de spawnear coyotes (como los vistos en los niveles normalmente), para que nos compliquen aun más la maniobrabilidad en el entorno, por último, luchamos contra un viejo desquiciado que daba vueltas sobre su pico (de picar piedra), el cual si nos rozaba, nos hacia perder el oro que habíamos ganado hasta ese entonces, pero no solo eso hace el desgraciado, si no que también puede arrojar barriles de dinamita, y cuando el pasa sobre ellos con su pico, explotan, llevándose todo a su paso. Este último malnacido si nos hizo caer en el siempre vergonzoso rage guit.

Cuando hablamos del oro que habiamos ganado, nos referimos a monedas que van soltando los enemigos a quienes hacemos volar con nuestras bombas, este dinero nos sirve para adquirir ciertos artículos en las tiendas que toparemos de forma aleatoria en algunas partes de los calabozos. Algunos de estos items sirven para regenerar los corazones de vitalidad, otros para regenerar el spirit (mana), o hasta nos permiten hacernos con mejoras de habilidades: correr más rápido, hacer crecer la estela del fuego de nuestras bombas, obtener más oro de los enemigos, corazones extra de HP, etc, estos últimos comentados, también pueden recogerse de la mayoría de jefes, y de algunos cofres que encontramos en cada mazmorra, aunque requieren de llaves que igualmente vamos recolectando en el camino.
 
Acá lo bueno es el elemento de rogue-like, donde si perdemos la totalidad de nuestra vida, tocará comenzar desde el primer nivel nuevamente. Lo que es mejor aún, es que los niveles no siempre serán los mismos gracias al algoritmo que hace que estos siempre sean diferentes, arrojando siempre una pantalla diferente en las que cambian hasta el jefe que encontraremos al final. De paso, todos los power ups que vayamos obteniendo en el camino aparecerán en un pequeño menú pre-partida en el cual nos dejan equipar uno o más (dependiendo de algunas variables) para poder entrar con ciertas ventajas al inicio de la partida; es algo opcional, y si somos lo suficientemente machos alfa podemos obviar estas ventajas y entrar como todo un leñador (y vaquero) de barba y pelo en pecho sin mejoras extra en las partidas.

A parte de algunas quejas que tenemos sobre el control del personaje (se siente un poco extraño al querer cambiar de dirección), todo  lo demás resulta bastante divertido. Claramente echamos de menos una posibilidad online para disfrutar con amigos que están lejos de casa, pero a veces con cosas que se ven limitadas por asuntos técnicos que son comprensibles.

review: Bombslinger is the kinda Bomber Man like concept I've been hoping for for years! I've enjoyed more than a few Bomber Man games but the same ol grid arena battles for the single player mode always felt lacking. Bombslinger has totally figured that scenario out! It plays more like the original Zelda, you can walk around a map in any direction, with seemingly random area designs for each new room you enter. Getting to use the Bomber Man four-way explosion mechanic in a kind of action RPG style game really gives it a feel all its own. Also the 2D/3D Pixel art style looks great and totally works with the overall aestetic of the game!

review:
I bought the game on sale, then after an hour or so of gameplay, asked for a refund. It's not because it's not a good game, but because it has too many things I'm looking for that is not yet available at this early stage of the game.

It would be great to have a co-op adventure, not just a multiplayer battle mode-- what I was looking for at this time as I was looking for something to play with my non-gamer wife.

To be fair, I still recommend the game. To be fair, I still will look forward to buying the full "explosive" potential of the game, but just not now.

It still is a lovable game and is the best Bomberman-like type of game I have seen and played on different platforms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009037942', 'num_games_owned': 893, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1486701747}
review:
Received this game from the developer only because someone impersonated me to get a copy and they(developers) contacted me VIA YouTube.

Here is my first look gameplay (sorry mic went weird on this recording) READ MORE full text review!
https://youtu.be/rJH2Gj5X3lc

But luck be have it I love pixel AND Bomberman style games... I am also a danger more to myself then others when bombs are left in my hands...

This game was a western twist to the Bomberman style which went actually well with its unique sprites enemies, bosses and adding in a rouge like feature when you start over every time you die, which irritates me but makes me that much more determined to beat this damn thing...
so here are the Pros and Cons

PROS

-Bombs
-Unique strategies needed to learn to progress and survive to achieve your vengence!
-Randomization of maps, enemies, powerups, shops
-Ability to not just find but BUY powerups
-Field of dreams did not have to deal with what we found hiding in the corn
-Goats

it's a bombergame you can't look for much else!

Cons

-No instructions provided for safety of you and your fingers
-Not enough powerups/lack of finding hiding in destructibles
-Cant afford expensive items in beginning of game
-Respawn item leaves you with HP you were on last map
-Lack of online multiplayer
-Goats

Starting over from scratch every time may be a pain but in the end you have to develop survival skills and tactics for each style of enemy making this game much more immersive then a normal bomber game would be, the music the theme, the characters all got me to keep playing!

review: When I got this game, I didn't know what to expect. What I got was a rouge like. (A rouge like is a type of game to were if you die, you have to start ALL over again, and the levels, items, shops, and enemeys are all randomly generated every time you restart.) This was fun for a good 30 minutes before I got tired of it. But that's only because I get tired of rouge likes really quickly. The game is an amazing game, it's got the old bomber man mechanic, killing enemys with differant types of bombs, and differant bomb upgrades, then taking down the boss, move on the next level, with stronger and tougher enemys. So if you like challanging rouge likes with interesting mechanics, then this is the game for YOU!

review:
[h1]A Roguelike Bomberman-Inspired Action Game[/h1]
https://youtu.be/29kqok1wlzQ
+ [b]The gameplay / combat is very similar to bomberman[/b]. You go around placing bombs to kill enemies while hiding behind rocks and such to avoid getting hurt in the blast. Fans of classic bomberman should enjoy Bombslinger.
+ [b]The single player campaign is very similar to games like The Binding of Isaac[/b]. You go from room to room fighting enemies while collecting upgrades, abilities, and money (used in the shop). At the end of each level is a rather challenging boss fight. 
+ Visually the game looks very unique. It has a top-down perspective, but some things are 3D while others are 2D which creates a very interesting style.
+ Challenging Boss fights
+ Lots of abilities, items, and upgrades that change the way you play, and are very helpful as you progress. 

[b]This game is in Early Access so these are subject to change[/b]
- The soundtrack or background music was very repetitive and honestly pretty dull. I feel like some better music could really help this game shine.
- I felt like there were too many obstacles on each stage. I spent a lot of time blowing up corn, grass, and fires which were simply in the way and blocking me from reaching exits or enemies.
- I realize the game is in EA, but I do feel like there should be more bosses, and they should be more randomized. It's a bit tiresome when you die and have to restart from the beginning knowing you will always fight the same bosses each time through.

review:
Bombslinger - приключенческая аркада о похождениях одинокого ковбоя. Разработкой данного проекта выступила компания Mode4.

Перед нами очень интересный проект, который, как по мне, воскрешает один из самых популярных игр на платформе Sega - Bomberman. Извините ребята, но не сравнить их попросту невозможно. Если же игра Bombslinger замышлялась как некая реанимация жанра взрывного Бомбермена, то можно сказать попытка довольно успешная. Сюжет в игре довольно прост, некий загадочный всадник убил жену главного героя и сжег его ферму дотла. И вот наш ковбой решает отомстить неприятелю, по пути уничтожая толпы фермеров, охотников, метателей молотова и козлов? Да почему бы и нет! Игра разделена на 4 главы, а одна глава разделяется на два действия. В конце каждого из них нас ожидает борьба с босом. Врать не буду, я прошел всего 2 главы и на уровне 3.1 - умер от своего же глупого поступка (загнал себя в угол). Хотелось бы отметить, что построение уровней очень похожа на игру The Binding of Isaac. То-есть, при уничтожении всех врагов на закрытой локации, открывается дверь на следующий уровень и так далее, до тех пор пока не перейдете на локацию с Боссом. Один из больших плюсов игры - это функция рогалика, что делает игру реиграбельной.

Боссы в игре самые разнообразные. К примеру: Ультракозел (нет, я не шучу) - может оттолкнуть вашу бомбу, если она стоит посреди поля. Пироман - поджигает все на своем пути, нужно обладать очень хорошей реакцией, чтобы уйти от его атак. Шахтер - очень быстрый босс, который носится по всей карте и взрывает огнеопасные бочки. Других боссов открывать не буду, дабы сохранить интригу при прохождении данного проекта. Хотелось бы отметить, что никаких контрольных точек или сохранения в игре нет. Если вы погибаете весь ваш прогресс сведется к нулю. С одной стороны - это делает игроку настоящий вызов. Но с другой - игра должна расслаблять, а не уничтожать весь твой прогресс.

Оружия в игре довольно большое количество: начиная от простых бомб и заканчивая молотовым. Также есть взрывные бочки, ножи, револьверы, обрезы. Сила взрыва бомбы может быть увеличена при нахождении опредленного улучшения в виде огненной мощи. Изначально наш ковбой может ставить лишь одну бомбу за раз, но при нахождении улучшения, он может ставить до 3-х бомб одновременно. На каждом из уровней есть локация с магазином, где вы сможете потратить деньги, которые падали с испепеленных тел ваших врагов, на случайным образом генерируемые три улучшения или оружия (там могут быть бобы, ружья, усиления взрыва, ловушки). Что же касается локаций: они делятся на несколько типов. Маленькая локация: на ней находится от двух до четырех соперников, на довольно маленькой территории. Большая локация - довольно обширна и на ней может уместится даже больше 10 различных видов неприятеля. Ну и не будем забывать про локацию с боссом. Она всегда одинакова: средних размеров карта, сделанная в виде некого подобия шахматной доски.

Что касается графической составляющей: игра выглядит довольно живо и красиво. Взрывы  красиво прорисованы. Насилие сведено к минимальному уровню, что относит игру к аудитории: для всех. Само собой это очень хорошо, так как вы можете поиграть в нее как сами, так и вместе с ребенком. Музыка выполнена в старых добрых традициях вестерна. Прорисовка всех персонажей и детализация каждого уровня очень радует глаз.

Под конец обзора хотелось бы перечислить плюсы и минусы проекта.

Плюсы:
+ Наличие сюжета
+ Вестерн+Бомбермен=удачное сочетание
+ Большое количество оружия, улучшения, ловушек
+ Разнообразие врагов на каждом из уровней
+ Графическая составляющая хорошо сочетается с музыкальным оформлением

Минусы:
- Отсутствие мультиплеера или лидерской доски (наличие мультиплеера обещается в будущем)
- Главный герой - главный злодей (поясняю: после смерти жены наш ковбой уничтожает все селения по пути к своей мести, что сделали обычные фермеры главному герою? Вывод: наш ковбой - маньяк=психопат)

Bombslinger - удачное возрождение Bomberman с новым графическим движком и интересной историей. Даю этой игре с перспективой 8,5 из 10.

review:
This game is really fun, but difficult and will take time to master. 
Obviously it takes the concept of bomberman, but the way they adapted it is brilliant. 
You won't get easily tired of it and new enemies and game mechanics introduce themselves as you continue in the game. 
The enemies might seem daunting in the beginning, but once you learn how they act, you'll be able to take them out. 
I've played this game from the beta and so many improvements are done already and the devs really listen to the players. 
I'm without doubt that the early access will still have improvements as more reviews come in. 
Maybe some interesting things for the devs: add a timer to it, so that maybe the community will start doing timed runs or other competitive things...

review:
I hope, the final version will be optimized. At the moment I'm more or less neutral.

The game is indeed pretty fun (just the playing). There are nice power ups - not much different from Bomberman - and many different enemies.

Two things annoy me at the moment: 
1) The controls are far from being precise. But I can live with that. It makes it a little bit frustrating, when you have a Molotov Cocktail and not a regular bomb. And you are not always going sideways like you should.
2) The very frustrating part (at least for me): You start at the ranch, it has two levels, each with one boss. OK. After some tries I reached the next scenario. It's getting much more difficult. I die. Where do I start? No, not at the beginning of the second scenario, but again at the very beginning, at the ranch! For some people this might be OK. For me this is a reason to not want to play this game too often. You have just one life. (With some hearts. But! There are enemies like the goats and coyotes that will follow you, you can't outrun them, if they manage to get too close: you're dead, because they will take all of your little hearts and you have no chance to do anything about it. They are not too difficult as enemy, when you're far away or getting closer carefully, but it happens that you get too close, especially when there is a large screen full of different enemies.) I think the gap, at the moment, between the effort/time you have to put in the game to reach higher levels/scenarios and the difficulty is too big.

review:
This game smell good the 90's! If you miss playing to your Super nes or your Mega Drive(Genesis), just click and buy this game!

It's not just a cowboy skin of bomberman, this game has much more to offer, mixing exploration like an old zelda and having tons of upgrades to discover over the game.

The game is fun, the feeling of explosion and power of using bombs is well done. Always a fresh map to explore each run. On the down side, I find the game a bit too hard, but i'm confident that Mode4 will look at that during the early access!

I've tested that game since a few weeks now, and what I can say is that they put tons of efforts in it. Mode4 listens to what their community can say, and they are very reactive about any proposition,  ideas or issues found!
